name: Soy-Dijon Chicken Wings
description: In this chicken wing sauce from Ming Tsai, black pepper is toasted in a medium-high skillet until it starts to smoke, then gets tossed with red wine, mustard, soy sauce, thyme, and lots of minced garlic. The sauce is tart and rich, with a haunting aroma of black pepper in the background.
recipeIngredient: 4 stalks of celery, sliced into 4 inch lengths
2 pounds chicken wings, drumettes and wings separated (tips discarded)

recipeInstructions.text: Add the black pepper to a skillet set over medium-high heat. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 2 to 4 minutes, until the black pepper is beginning to smoke. Transfer to a large bowl along with the red wine, Dijon mustard, soy sauce, thyme, and garlic. Stir well, and then whisk in the 1/2 cup canola oil.
Pour enough oil to come 1/3 of the way up the size of a medium sized pot. Turn the heat to medium high and bring to a temperature of a 375°F. Adjust the heat to maintain that temperature.
